Guide to AEME

guide-aeme.Rmd
library(AEME)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'AEME'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     time

Introduction

We will load in an Aeme object and demonstrate how to access data and input variables into the object.

We will use lake Wainamu as an example.

rds_file <- system.file("extdata/lernzmp/LID45819.rds", package = "AEME")
aeme <- readRDS(rds_file)
class(aeme)
#> [1] "Aeme"
#> attr(,"package")
#> [1] "AEME"

The Aeme object is an S4 R object that contains all the data and input variables required to run the AEME model.

We can view all the slots within this object using the slotNames function.

slotNames(aeme)
#>  [1] "lake"          "time"          "configuration" "observations" 
#>  [5] "input"         "inflows"       "outflows"      "water_balance"
#>  [9] "output"        "parameters"

Access data

To access the data from each of the ‘slots’ within the Aeme object, we can use functions of the same name as the slot to retrieve the data.

For example, to access the data from the lake slot, we can use the lake() function.


lke <- lake(aeme)
lke
#> $name
#> [1] "Wainamu"
#> 
#> $id
#> [1] "LID45819"
#> 
#> $latitude
#> [1] -36.88921
#> 
#> $longitude
#> [1] 174.4669
#> 
#> $elevation
#> [1] 23.2
#> 
#> $depth
#> [1] 13.48
#> 
#> $area
#> [1] 153648

Each of the slots is a list containing the data required to run the AEME model.

class(lke)
#> [1] "list"

Update data

If you wish to update the data within the Aeme object, you must:

  1. Extract the data from the slot using the associated function
  2. Update the data
  3. Assign the updated data back to the slot using the associated function

For example, to update the lake name, you can do the following:

lke <- lake(aeme) # Extract the data
lke$name <- "TEST NAME" # Update the data
lake(aeme) <- lke # Assign the updated data back to the slot
aeme
#>             AEME 
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   Lake
#> TEST NAME (ID: LID45819); Lat: -36.89; Lon: 174.47; Elev: 23.2m; Depth: 13.48m;
#> Area: 153648 m2
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   Time
#> Start: 2013-07-01; Stop: 2023-06-30; Time step: 3600
#>  Spin up (days): GLM: 1095; GOTM: 1095; DYRESM: 1095
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   Configuration
#>     Model controls: Present
#>           Physical   |   Biogeochemical
#> DY-CD    : Absent     |   Absent 
#> GLM-AED  : Present    |   Present
#> GOTM-WET : Present    |   Present
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   Observations
#> Lake: Present; Level: Absent
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   Input
#> Inital profile: Present; Inital depth: 13.48m; Hypsograph: Present (n=53);
#> Meteo: Present; Use longwave: TRUE; Kw: 1.214286
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   Inflows
#> Data: Present; Scaling factors: DY-CD: 1; GLM-AED: 1; GOTM-WET: 1
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   Outflows
#> Data: Present; Scaling factors: DY-CD: 1; GLM-AED: 1; GOTM-WET: 1
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   Water balance
#> Method: 2; Use: obs; Modelled: Absent; Water balance: Present
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   Parameters: 
#> Number of parameters: 18
#> -------------------------------------------------------------------
#>   Output: 
#> Number of ensembles: 1
#> DY-CD:    1
#> GLM-AED:  1
#> GOTM-WET: 1

The Aeme object now contains the updated lake name.

Update the input data

To update the input data, you can follow the same process as updating the data.

Lake
